title: Tracking issue for Iterator::try_fold and try_rfold (feature iterator_try_fold)

labels.name: T-libs-api
labels.description: Relevant to the library API team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: final-comment-period
labels.description: In the final comment period and will be merged soon unless new substantive objections are raised.

labels.name: C-tracking-issue
labels.description: Category: A tracking issue for an RFC or an unstable feature.

body:
The core internal iteration methods in terms of which the other `Iterator` methods can be implemented.

PR https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/45595, commit b32267f -- merged 2017-11-17
https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/std/iter/trait.Iterator.html#method.try_fold
https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/std/iter/trait.DoubleEndedIterator.html#method.try_rfold

Also `try_for_each` (PR https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/48157, merged 2018-02-24), a convenience method that can be considered the fallible version of `for_each` or the stateless version of `try_fold`.
https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/std/iter/trait.Iterator.html#method.try_for_each

Pre-stabilization question list:

- [ ] Are these the best type parameters? https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/45462
- [x] Should there be a `try_foreach` as well? https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/45379#issuecomment-340239840
- [ ] Stabilize `rfold` before `try_rfold`? https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/45594#issuecomment-342673373
- [ ] Stabilize `try_fold` before the others? https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/45594#issuecomment-367128189
